column4: When I delete files, and empty trash my free space does not increase
ï»¿When I delete files, and empty trash my free space does not increase.  Currently I have 0 free space, and it my system is suffering a bit
what did you do?
well just the normal right click delete, empty trash on icon.  Files are not in the trash can.
what ubuntu do you have?
look into ~/.local/share/Trash/files
if there are any hidden files left
no hidden files in trash
try using the 'disk usage analyser' to find out what eats up your space

well the disk analyzer looks right, says my home is 100% when i delete something it shows it has been deleted when I run the analyzer, but I am still at 0 free space, ths is after I deleted a 700 mb iso
try deleting something using the 'rm' command in the terminal
after using rm, I still have 0 bytes remaining
do you get any error messages?
nope
I'm running out of ideas... | try deleting something as root (or sudo) or try fsck on your partition using the live cd
yeah I am in root right now with nautilus, I am looking for the .trash
as of ubuntu 8.04 the .trash folder was moved to .local/share/trash
i appreciate your help, I am going to do a restart, then its live cd time
sorry if I couldn't help...
Hey, well i got some of my space back, it says 15.3 gigs available, i should have about 54 gigs available.  No idea what happened
